description: Middle English, from Middle French fertile, from Old French fertile, from Latin fertilis (“fruitful, fertile”), from ferō (“I bear, carry”).

adjectives.description: fertile (comparative more fertile, superlative most fertile)

entries.meaning: Of land, etc.: capable of growing abundant crops; productive.
(figuratively) Of one's imagination, etc.: active, productive, prolific.

examples: Most women at the age of fifty are not fertile.

entries.meaning: Capable of developing past the egg stage.
(physics) Not itself fissile, but able to be converted into a fissile material by irradiation in a reactor.
examples: There are two basic fertile materials: uranium-238 and thorium-232.
